column4: hi, after I installe the nvidia restricted driver on Xubuntu 7.1 AMD64 the text size shrunk in everything and even when I decrease the resolution it statys  small.  help please

You could try going into your display settings and change the font size, but probably what happened is that your resolution got changed to something besides 96dpi which is the default for most monitors.
can't quite find where to do that it xfce
in xfce, it's under Settings>User Interface Settings
Oh sorry, that's for changing the font size.... which won't fix your problem
that fixed it in most places but text in apps like xchat is still small
you might need to restart xchat for things to take effect. Can you restart X and come back in and tell me if everything stayed the same?
still small text in the pane that shows the ongoing conversation
yes, for some reason this seems only to happen in xfce but not gnome
This happened to me on my laptop. Before we change the dpi resolution, try to change the refresh rate around in XFCE>Settings>Screens and Graphics
how's that working out? I am gonna go take a smoke break, I'll be back in 10.
the only resolution that made any difference was going down to 320x240 and then the text just got big and blurry
Don't change the resolution, change the refresh rate, say if you are running, 50 Hz, try 53 and so on... one of them might make a difference
